newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat ends higher, locals main buyers.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat ends higher, locals main buyers.

text.p: MGE spring wheat futures closed slightly higher with locals the main buyers amid signs that export demand may be picking up.
Dealers said the recent fall in prices appeared to have reawakened export interest with several Asian buyers in the market for U.S. wheat this week.

They noted key buyers included Cargill Investor Services (1.1 million bushels September) and Country Hedging (900,000 bushels July). Sellers included Prudential (1.6 million July), Cargill (3.0 million July) and Benson Quinn (1.0 million July).
July closed 5-3/4 cents a bushel higher at $4.28-1/2.
Other months finished four to seven cents higher.

Dealers noted USDA put export sales for the week to May 1 at 176,200 tonnes, slightly below trade expectations for 200,000 to 300,000 tonnes. Prices at the end of April were, however, around 20 cents a bushel above current levels.
Volume on spring wheat was estimated at 29,343,000 bushels. Feed barley remained tradeless.
